column4: there shouldnt be a need to change the runlevel anyway because runlevels 2-5 remain identical in debian/ubuntu
yeah, but I stil want to know how to do it
hrrm, i have no idea really -- except of a workaround - create the last script in /etc/rc2.d that sends you to another runlevel using init/telinit :)
probably one of the files in -- dpkg -L upstart
